text: and have you added this policy in general HubSpot settings or just for a particular page in <head> section? :)

Hi everyone, someone copied our website to another URL, and it's ranking on Google. How can we remove it? Has anyone dealt with this before? <http://www.xtroy.org/constraint-based-configurations.html> *(Be careful when clicking, this page isn't secure.)*

Hi <@U076Y975BU5>,
could you please provide some more insights about "someone copied our website to another domain"?
Was it someone from your team or was it some sort of scam/hack "attack"?
also - please *do not* share details like private data/access keys or something here
Yeah you gotta add everything, google, twitter, HubSpot cdns. You can add it in your HubSpot security settings for your domain

Hey everyone, we try to reduce the formating options of richtext editors with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/rich-text-editor#how-to-use-enabled-features|enabled_features>, unfortunately it seems there's no option to enable the AI content assistant (at least not from the docs). Any ideas if this is possible or are we out of luck and have to enable all options again?

I am looking for a custom solution for the following:

• We need a landing page with qualifying questions, 
• Based on one of the multiple choices we provide, I need the user to be directed either to a calendar, or to another landing page. 
Any idea where I can get help to implement this?

Hi all, our team is looking to identify HubSpot scripts that we've found running on our domain. It was identified by our compliance team identified them using Osana, but we are struggling to figure out where they are coming from.

Has anyone seen these scripts appearing on their websites before?

These scripts are showing up on our domains that are separate from a HubSpot-created landing page, but we suspect that our landing page may be tied to the scripts showing up.

<https://js.hs-analytics.net/analytics/>
<https://js.hscollectedforms.net/collectedforms.js>
<https://js.hs-scripts.com/20193643.js>
<https://js.hs-scripts.com/2123903.js>
<https://app.HubSpot.com/events-visualizer.js>

cc: <@U07KPNKMVC3>

Hi <@UJAPS2K4N>,  an unknown domain has directly copied our website. Honestly, I'm not sure how they managed to do it. Some buttons still refer back to our original website. Additionally, I submitted a DMCA request to Google, but I'm not sure how long it will take them to review it.

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.
Hi <@U07KS8M6XSQ>, Can you confirm that the qualifying questions are from a HubSpot form embed on your LP?

If so it’s quite easy to set up :
On your form > Options > Conditional redirect

Hey all,
I’ve got a multilingual website, but unfortunately, HubSpot doesn’t automatically add an x-default hreflang tag :pensive:
I can figure out how to implement it when all the other URLs are the same, but I’m struggling to find a solution when the URLs in other languages are different and translated.
For example, on a contact page:
```<link rel="alternate" hreflang="en-us" href="../company/contact-us">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="de-de" href="../de-de/unternehmen/über-uns">```
I need a function that retrieves the primary language URL of the page. Which would be:
```<link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="../company/contact-us">```
Do you know if such a function exists or anyone got a solution to this problem?
Thanks

These are standard scripts for HubSpot analytics and most set up recommendations ask you to install the script across all top-level domains for tracking web activity. 
Is there a concern in them running?

Hello everybody,

I need to create a marketing form with 5 dependent fields. Problem is that conditional logic properties don't work in Sales Pro.
What is the best option to work around?
